thread.section_title: Australian Business & World Finance News - Yahoo!7 Finance
thread.title: Qantas, Woolies discussing loyalty program

title: Qantas, Woolies discussing loyalty program
text:
Fri, Oct 23, 2015, 6:29 PM AEDT - Australia Markets closed Qantas, Woolies discussing loyalty program AAP – 46 minutes ago Print 
Qantas chief executive Alan Joyce has labelled Woolworths an important partner as the supermarket giant reviews its loyalty program link to the airline. 
Woolworths is reviewing its Everyday Rewards loyalty program, and is reportedly looking at removing Qantas frequent flyer points due to their high cost. 
Mr Joyce has confirmed the two companies are in discussions. 
"We regard Woolworths as an important loyalty partner and of course Qantas would like to continue dialogue with them," Mr Joyce told the Qantas annual general meeting. 
"But we have to have the right solution for all customers as well as Woolworths having the right solution for their customers." 
Mr Joyce said the airline would not be disadvantaged financially if Woolworths opted to not renew their six year relationship when the current terms expire at the end of the year. 
"It's probably inappropriate for me to talk about it while those commercial discussions are occurring but I will say that the impact on this from an EBIT (earnings before interest and tax) point of view is not significant to our loyalty operation," Mr Joyce said. 
Woolworths has refused to verify reports it is seeking to exit the relationship. 
Shoppers currently earn frequent flyer points when they shop at Woolworths, Big W or BWS stores. 
"We will have more information in the coming weeks," a company statement said. @y7finance on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook Qantas fuel costs fall again 'not by luck' AAP 
Qantas expects fuel costs to drop by as much as $290 million this financial year, but chief executive Alan Joyce …
